Driver:  I20051116_2235

In a workspace, I configured Tomcat 5.5, 5.0, 4.1 and 4.0, then I ran through a 
couple of Web service client scenarios without first creating any server or 
projects.  After that, I stop the server and deleted all projects (including 
the servers project).

Then I go through a skeleton scenario, on the 2nd page, paste in the URL:

http://www.xmethods.net/sd/2001/TemperatureService.wsdl

Hit Next, on the 3rd page, all the fields are empty.

I can provide the workspace that would reproduce the problem.

However, I cannot reproduce the problem in another workspace.
Hi Rupam, I'll send you the workspace so that you can take a look.

This problem still shows up intermittenly with the M9 driver.  Here's the stack trace:

I was able to consistently reproduce the problem once the workspace got into that bad state.  But when I exited, and re-opened the same workspace, that particular scenario was working again.

Could the project(s) just be in a bad state and re-opening them fixed them?

I have the workspace, but I doubt it'd be of any use.

If I click Finish on the first page, then I get "Unable to get URL for project {0}.  The problem did not go away if I just "close" and "open" the project in the workbench.  It went away if I exit the workbench and re-enter.

The symptoms and Exception traces described in all the comments (with the exception of comment #6) seem to indicate that RuntimeServerSelectionWidget.getStatus(..) is getting called before the data mapping engine has set its ids_ attribute by calling setTypeRuntimeServer. 

I put a breakpoint at the beginning of RuntimeServerSelectionWidget.getStatus(..) to see what was triggering the early call to getStatus(..). The culprit is ProjectSelectionWidget.setComponentTypeId(..). The reason for the intermittent nature of the problem is that the order in which the data mapping engine calls the setters in not deterministic so most of the time setTypeRuntimeServer(..) is getting called before setService/ClientProjectName(..). On the rare case when setComponentTypeId is getting called before setTypeRuntimeServer, the NullPointerException occurs.

The fix for this involves turning off the listener on the projectType widget at the beginning of setComponentTypeId and turining the listener on again at the end.
Targetting for a fix in M10.

Created an attachment (id=31231)
apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/src/org/eclipse/jst/ws/internal/consumption/ui/widgets/runtime/ProjectSelectionWidget.java

patch 1 of 1

The attached patch is ready to be committed. In addition to turning listeners off in ProjectSelectionWidget's setComponentType method, I also turned listeners off in setNeedEAR. In both cases, the presence of the listeners was causing premature page validation which resulted in a NullPointerException. I also verified that the data mapping engine is the only one using these setters and that the listeners are not doing anything besides triggering page validation. Peter Moogk has reviewed the changes.
Have not seen this problem with RC2 or RC3.
